span.span:
The Farmington Historical Society Awards of Scholarship to a graduating Farmington High School senior, who has demonstrated an appreciation and interest for history. The awardee must be attending an institution of higher education and must either be pursuing a degree in history or the social studies, elementary education, or has previously demonstrated previous civic engagement activities that support and promote the preservation of Farmington history. The scholarship, a minimum of $500, is awarded after demonstrating successful completion of the first semester studies and an intent to continue another semester of those studies.
Find out more and apply at: https://www.farmingtonnhhistory.org/p/scholarship-program.html
Summary *Students will learn remotely March 23 to April 6 * All buildings are closed to students and general public * Please email any concerns to your student's teacher or guidance counselor. Teachers and staff have spent the week preparing for remote learning. We miss having kids around and we are looking forward to next week. The Farmington School District will continue to provide breakfast and lunch to our students during this time. _______________________

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: "times new roman", serif; text-align: center;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: "times new roman", serif; text-align: center;

strong.div: Farmington High School is currently in the beginning stages of getting accredited through NEAS&C. To do this, we need your support and comments on what the school is currently doing. Please take a moment to complete the survey below by clicking on the link. The survey is completely anonymous and will help the accreditation process and the committee going forward.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: "times new roman", serif; text-align: center;

strong.div: If you have any questions, please reach out to Barbara Gardner (bgardner@sau61.org), Whitney Carrier (wcarrier@sau61.org), or Kaili Varley (kvarley@sau61.org).

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: "times new roman", serif; text-align: center;

div.p: Our mission is to provide a quality education through shared responsibility in a safe supportive environment for all students to meet the challenges of a global society.

We are “Committed to Excellence”, and we work hard to make the site a primary source for timely information for all users, and a main gateway for improved communication between parents, teachers, students and other members of our community. Our goal and responsibility is to help each student develop an enthusiasm for learning, a respect for self and others, and the skills to become a creative independent thinker and problem solver.
